summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from December 2019, where a Norwegian journalist inquires about a quote attributed to an anonymous FBI agent regarding the FBI's interest in speaking with a person (name redacted) who traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet. The email seeks clarification on the FBI's intentions and any contact with Norwegian authorities.

persons.name: Runa Fjellanger
persons.context: Norwegian journalist from VG newspaper who sent the initial inquiry to the FBI's National Press Office, asking about the FBI's interest in a person connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation; the inquiry is about the FBI's efforts to trace information about him and speak with individuals who traveled on his private jet.

persons.name: Crown Princess Mette-Marit
persons.context: Mentioned in the journalist's inquiry regarding whether there has been any contact between American agencies and Norwegian authorities concerning her in relation to Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: According to flight logs, the unnamed individual traveled with Jeffrey Epstein's private jet several times, prompting FBI interest.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry to FBI
events.description: Norwegian journalist Runa Fjellanger sends an email to the FBI's National Press Office inquiring about a quote from an anonymous FBI agent regarding the FBI's desire to speak with an individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A Norwegian journalist inquired about a quote attributed to an anonymous FBI agent at the American embassy in Stockholm regarding the FBI's interest in speaking with an individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein.
The individual of interest reportedly traveled on Jeffrey Epstein's private jet several times, according to flight logs.
The inquiry asked whether the FBI had contacted Norwegian authorities, including the Police Security Service, concerning Jeffrey Epstein or Crown Princess Mette-Marit.
The email chain shows internal FBI forwarding of the press inquiry, indicating ongoing media and investigative interest in Epstein's network in late 2019.
